tag_list: entrepreneurship, startups, analytics, go-to-market, marketing, cloud-computing, user-communities, enterprise-cloud, enterprise-software, performance-based-marketing, scalable-online-operations, ed-tech, music
overview:
John Adractas is an entrepreneurial marketing and product executive with both B2B and B2C experience. He is known for contagious energy, blazing whiteboards, and straight-to-the-point analytics.

In 2010, John co-founded OnSophic (FKA: ExLibrix), a Enterprise Cloud company focused on higher education. As COO/Head of Product & Marketing, he developed their go-to-market strategy, customer pitch, financial model, and corporate operating plan and co-led customer and investor discussions.

In 2009, John joined AcademixDirect, a digital marketing company focused on higher education. COO/Head of Product & Marketing, he managed half the company and oversaw a profitable, multi-million dollar performance marketing budget. He doubled the sellable lead supply while increasing quality and maintaining a high gross margin.

In 2006, John joined Google to manage the global customer operations team for Google Maps, Earth, and SketchUp. He led his teams to build community management and ultra-scaled service for 100MM+ active users, including consumers, “prosumers”, and enterprises.

He also helped found a enterprise software company, Zeborg (acquired by IBM/Emptoris), was a venture capitalist with Voyager Capital, a strategy consultant with BCG and MMG, and a professional pianist.

John has an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in Math and Philosophy from the University of Pennsylvania.
